main event: On October 17, 1958, a round object as large as the head of a pin and blood-red in color was observed approximately 500 feet above the Hudson River.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 5 minutes,The weather was overcast but visibility was good,A gust of wind shook the object but it remained steady,The object was noted to be on the New Jersey side of the Hudson River,The investigation concluded that the sighting was likely a balloon.
witness description: Mr. Joseph Jones, a civilian resident from 520 West 50th Street, New York City.
